lines.gurmukhi: ipRQm hI iql boey DUir imil bUtu bwDY; eyk sY Anyk hoq pRgt sMswr mY [

Unknown.translation: A sesame seed is Sown that mixes with earth to become a plant. One seed gives several seeds and spreads in the world in many forms.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: pihl pRQmy iek iql sUKm mwqR bIj hI huMdw hY, ijs nUM boey bIijAwˆ, DUVI im`tI ivc imldy swr,auh bUtu bwDY bUtw ho vDdw hY, Xw bUty dy srUp ivc auh bwDY bMDwXmwn gRsq ho jwˆdw hY, ArQwq bUtw bx pYˆdw hY[ Aru iesy qrHwˆ iek qoˆ Aykwˆ bx ky sMswr ivc pRgt hoXw krdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: koaU lY cbwie koaU Kwl kwFY ryvrI kY; koaU krY iqlvw imlwie gur bwr mY [

Unknown.translation: Some munch them (sesame seeds), some coat sugar balls with them (Rewari) while others mix them with jaggery syrup and make cake/biscuit like eatables.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: koeI qwˆ hux ienwˆ AnMq hoey iqlwˆ nUM lY lY ky c`bdw hY, qy koeI ienwˆ nUM CVky auprlI iC`l lwh ky eynwˆ dIAwˆ irauVIAwˆ bxwˆdw hY, Aqy koeI guV dy pwxI Bwv p`q Xw cwhxI ivc imlw ky iqlOˆfy iql mrUMfy bxOˆdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: koaU auKlI fwir kUit iqlkut krY koaU; kolU pIir dIp idpq AMiDAwr mY [

Unknown.translation: Some grind them and mix them with milk paste to make a form of sweet-meat, some squeeze them to extract oil and use it for burning lamp and lighting up their homes.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: AYsw hI koeI au`KlI ivc pw ky ienwˆ dI ku`t ku`t ky iqlku`t Bu`gw qÎwr kdw hY Aqy koeI kolU ivc pIV pIV qyl eynwˆ dw kF ky hnyry ivc dIivAwˆ ivKy pw pw bwldy hn[

lines.gurmukhi: jw ky eyk iql ko bIcwru n khq AwvY; Aibgiq giq kq Awvq bIcwr mY [273[

Unknown.translation: When multiplicity of one sesame seed of the creator cannot be explained, how can the unknowable, formless Lord be known? (273)
